channel.title: Member, ill rep++ best helper!
channel.description:
the source im using has members and its a bug to have to get people to log and and then i go to my files and make them a member so how do i remove member ship or how do i add ::givemember
If u no how to remove it tell me, and if u no how to add ::givemember, then give me the code :D
I'll rep++ best helper! :) :)

item.title: Member, ill rep++ best helper!
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

Might not work, but give it a shot. If any error’s please post.

Declare in client.java,

public int playerIsMember;

And under,

public void customcommand

Add,

if (command.startsWith("givemember") && playerRights >= 2) { String Mem = command.substring(10); try { int Mem2 = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Mem); client Memb = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Mem2]; Memb.playerIsMemb = 1; Memb.saveChar();//Your save char method, could be saveCharacter(); or whatever... Memb.savemoreinfo();//You will have this i hope. Memb.disconnected = true; } catch (Exception E) { sendMessage(Mem+" is either offline, or does not exist."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Member, ill rep++ best helper!
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“dagger9090, post:8, topic:232671”]well since the code didnt work and the other thing by the reaper is just gay can u tell me how to remove it :D[/quote]since you called me gay, no.

and if you don’t know how to change what you just did, your an idiot. i told you one thing (which was correct) I don’t see how you can’t possibly figure out how to remove it.

Go into your player.java and search for “ismember”. Next to it, it should say = 0. if it said 1 instead of 0, than that was what was making your players members automatically. I’m not wrong, you just don’t know wtf you’re doing and blame it on me.

No offense btw, because I’m not a jerk. Came here to help.

Read full topic

item.title: Member, ill rep++ best helper!
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:3, topic:232671”]go into player.java

Search for “ismember”

next to it, i guess it would say = 1.

change the 1 to a 0.

Explaination:

Player.java is the file that has the code in it that creates specifics in the character file. So changing ismember = 1 to ismember = 0 would make every member that creates a new account, to start off with 0, rather than 1.[/quote]

He wanted a command now how to do it.
He clearly says,

how do i add ::givemember

Read full topic

item.title: Member, ill rep++ best helper!
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

go into player.java

Search for “ismember”

next to it, i guess it would say = 1.

change the 1 to a 0.

Explaination:

Player.java is the file that has the code in it that creates specifics in the character file. So changing ismember = 1 to ismember = 0 would make every member that creates a new account, to start off with 0, rather than 1.

note - This doesn’t modify character files that have already been created.

Read full topic

item.title: Member, ill rep++ best helper!
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“membership”)) {
String member = command.substring(11);

        sendMessage("Player " + member + " has become a Member!");

        for (int a = 1; a < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; a++) {
            if (PlayerHandler.players[a] != null) {
                if (PlayerHandler.players[a].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(
                        member)) {
                    PlayerHandler.players[a].playerIsMember = 1;
                }
            }
        }

    }[/code]

Read full topic
